All device Internet traffic is being secured through the VPN.

Is the VPN causing problems with an app?
You can exclude apps from the VPN without turning the VPN off.

resources.string: VPN is connected and routing device traffic through %1$s.
Your VPN app may be disconnected
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Enabling DuckDuckGo VPN may disconnect any active VPN on your device.
Your VPN app is blocking DuckDuckGo VPN
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Open Network settings > VPN. Find the VPN app that’s “always-on” and disable it to continue.
Go to your device’s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and enable Always-on VPN to prevent Android disabling protection.\n\nMake sure to leave the other setting OFF.
To avoid app issues, go to your device\'s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and disable Block connections without VPN.
The VPN is disabled.\nA VPN app on your device may have disabled it. Use the toggle to re-enable.
Action required! To avoid app issues, you need to change your Android settings. Change settings
DuckDuckGo VPN is free to use during beta.
In App Battery Settings, allow Unrestricted usage to prevent Android from disabling the VPN in the background
In App Battery Settings, this prevents Android from disabling the VPN in the background
Automatically restore a VPN connection after interruption
Bypass the VPN for local network connections, like to a printer.
DuckDuckGo VPN prevents DNS leaks to your Internet Service Provider by routing DNS queries though the VPN tunnel to our own resolver.
Get notified if your connection drops or VPN status changes
Prevents Android from stopping the VPN.
Temporarily snooze the VPN when Wi-Fi calls are in progress and automatically reconnect after
To enable this setting, you need to let DuckDuckGo make and manage phone calls via system settings.
DuckDuckGo VPN works across all apps by default. If you’re experiencing app issues with the VPN enabled, try disabling protection for that app.
App issues may occur if enabled

string.name: netpExclusionListManuallyDisableAppDialogLabel
string.instruction: Placeholder is the name of an app

resources.string: Please let us know if you disabled the VPN for %1$s because you experienced app issues.\n\nWe\'ll also disable App Tracking Protection for %1$s.
Report an Issue With an App
This will update your custom protection settings and enable the VPN for all apps. You can always change your protection settings again later.
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.
Internet traffic, including background connections, used by this group of apps won\'t be protected by the VPN. Consider re-enabling if this doesn\'t fix the issue to prevent unexpected data leaks.

The VPN uses the open source WireGuard protocol to configure a virtual private network (VPN) on your device. When enabled, all of your device traffic is first encrypted and then routed through the nearest VPN server to protect your browsing activity from Internet service providers and hide your location from apps and sites you visit.
Is only my web browsing protected?
All of the network activity on your device is protected.
Does DuckDuckGo keep logs of my data?
No, we do not store logs.
Where are the VPN servers located?
DuckDuckGo offers a limited number of servers while DuckDuckGo VPN is in beta, located in the United States, Canada, and Europe.
Why do some apps not work when the VPN is on?

Some websites and apps intentionally limit access to people using a VPN. For example, they may ask you to solve a CAPTCHA to ensure you\'re a real person instead of a bot. If you experience repeated issues with an app, you can exclude it from the VPN altogether under DuckDuckGo VPN settings.
Why can\'t I dismiss VPN notifications?
Android requires that VPNs show a persistent notification while the VPN is enabled.
Is the VPN compatible with App Tracking Protection?
Yes, both the VPN and App Tracking Protection can be on at the same time. No other VPNs are compatible with DuckDuckGo App Tracking Protection.
Is the VPN free to use?
DuckDuckGo VPN is free to use while in beta. Eventually it will be offered as a paid service.
VPN is disconnected. Tap to continue securing your device traffic.
A VPN app on your device disconnected the DuckDuckGo VPN. Tap to reconnect.

resources.string: VPN disconnected due to expired subscription

Please wait while we verify your subscription…
Oops! You don’t have any valid subscription.
Oops! Your subscription is not valid for DuckDuckGo VPN.
Private DNS is already specified in System DNS Settings. Turn off Private DNS to set a custom DNS for DuckDuckGo VPN. Open System Settings
Using a custom DNS server can impact browsing speeds and expose your activity to third parties if the server isn\'t secure or reliable.
DuckDuckGo routes DNS queries through our DNS servers so your internet provider can\'t see what websites you visit.

resources.string: Automatically exclude apps not compatible with VPNs
Some apps, like banking or streaming apps, don\'t work well with VPNs. When this setting is enabled, we\'ll automatically exclude those apps.
